questions.answer_text: ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words is a project that provides custom nodes to access tags used to trigger Lora in ComfyUI.

questions.question_text: Is ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words compatible with Stacked Loras?
questions.answer_text: Yes, ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words is compatible with Stacked Loras from https://github.com/LucianoCirino/efficiency-nodes-comfyui/releases.

questions.question_text: Does ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words support Lycoris as well?
questions.answer_text: Yes, ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words supports both Lora and Lycoris.

questions.question_text: What are the different types of nodes available in ComfyUI-Lora-Auto-Trigger-Words?
questions.answer_text: The nodes available are: LoraLoader (Vanilla or Advanced), LoraLoaderStacked (Vanilla or Avanced), TagsFormater, tagsSelector, FusionText, Randomizer, and TextInputBasic.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the LoraLoaderAdvanced and LoraLoaderStacked nodes?
questions.answer_text: LoraLoaderAdvanced and LoraLoaderStacked nodes allow loading a lora either the normal way or the efficiency-nodes way and provide two custom outputs: civitai_tags_list and meta_tags_list.

questions.question_text: What is the function of the TagsFormater node?
questions.answer_text: The TagsFormater node is a helper to show the available tag and their indexes.
Yes, TagsSelectors can be chained to select different tags with different weights.

questions.question_text: What is needed for the 'showText' node to know the content of the tag lists?
questions.answer_text: For the 'showText' node to know the content of the tag lists, Custom-Scripts is recommended to be installed.

questions.question_text: What do the custom outputs civitai_tags_list and meta_tags_list provide?
questions.answer_text: civitai_tags_list provides a Python list of the tags related to this lora on Civitai, while meta_tags_list provides a Python list of the tags used for training the lora embedded in it.

questions.question_text: What is the function of the 'tagsSelector' node?
questions.answer_text: The 'tagsSelector' node allows filtering tags and applying a weight to them. It has four parameters: selector, weight, ensure_comma, and append_loraname_if_empty.
